Key Match Events: Chinglensana Singh narrowly missed a header from Anirudh Thapa's corner in the 6th minute.
Mauritius had their best chance in the 42nd minute with Emmanuel Vincent's first-time shot just above the crossbar.
Pre-Game Insights: This was the first match for India's new head coach Manolo Márquez.
Experts might have favored India based on their form and home advantage.
Post-Match Reflections: Manolo Márquez acknowledged India's possession but criticized their finishing.
Mauritius' captain Lyndsay Rose was praised for his defensive leadership.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was India's first in 16 years in Hyderabad.
The introduction of substitutions like Sahal Abdul Samad and Nandhakumar Sekar added energy to India's play.
